 I. <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עָטָה‎</span> **verb** ==wrap oneself, enwrap envelop oneself== (Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***cover, conceal***; Aramaic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***extinguish, destroy***; Assyrian <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***e‰û***</u></abbr>, ***be dark***, <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***e‰ûtu***</u></abbr>, ***darkness***); — 

**Qal** ***Perfect*** 3 masculine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וְע‎</span> (consecutive) [[Jer.43.12|Jer 43:12]] 3 plural <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וְעָטוּ‎</span> (consecutive) [[Mic.3.7|Mic 3:7]] ***Imperfect*** 3 masculine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יַעְטֶה‎</span> [[Lev.13.45|Lev 13:45]] + 2 t., <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וַיַּ֫עַט‎</span> [[Isa.59.17|Isa 59:17]] 2 masculine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎תַּעְטֶה‎</span> [[Ezek.24.17|Ezek 24:17]] 3 masculine plural <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יַעֲטוּ‎</span> ([[BDB#Baer|Baer]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יַעְ‎</span>) [[Ps.71.13|Ps 71:13]]; [[Ps.109.29|Ps 109:29]] 2 masculine plural <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎תַּעְטוּ‎</span> [[Ezek.24.22|Ezek 24:22]] ***Participle active*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עֹטֶה‎</span> [[1Sam.28.14|1Sam 28:14]]; [[Ps.104.2|Ps 104:2]] feminine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עֹטְיָה‎</span> [[Song.1.7|Song 1:7]] — 

**1.** ***wrap, envelop*** oneself ***with something*** (accusative, like <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לבשׁ‎</span>): <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וְהוּא עֹטֶה מְעִיל‎</span> [[1Sam.28.14|1Sam 28:14]] an old man ascending, ***and he is enwrapped in a robe***; so <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הָרֹעֶה בִּגְדוֺ‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יַע‎</span> [[Jer.43.12|Jer 43:12]] (sim), and <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֶתאֶֿרֶץ‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וְע‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מִצְרֵיִם‎</span> v[[Jer.43.12|Jer 43:12]] ***he will wrap himself in the land of Egypt*** (use it as a robe, figurative, of Nebuchadnezzar; so completely will it be in his power, [[BDB#Gf|Gf]]); so figurative of <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎י‎</span>, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וַיַּעַטַ כַּמְעִיל קִנְאָה‎</span> [[Isa.59.17|Isa 59:17]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ׅ‎</span> \|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎(לָבַשׁ‎</span>, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֿוֺר כַּשַּׁלְמָה‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ע‎</span> [[Ps.104.2|Ps 104:2]] of men, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כְּבֶגֶד יַע‎</span> [[Ps.109.19|Ps 109:19]] (simile \|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לָבַשׁ‎</span> v[[Ps.109.18|Ps 109:18]]), <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כַמְעִיל בָּשְׁתָּם‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וְיַע‎</span> v[[Ps.109.29|Ps 109:29]] (\|\| ***id.***), <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יַע‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎חָרְפָּה וגי‎</span> [[Ps.71.13|Ps 71:13]] with <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַל‎</span> of part covered, in phrase <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וְעָטוּ עַלשָֿׂפָם‎</span> [[Mic.3.7|Mic 3:7]] ***they shall envelop themselves upon their beard*** (cover the beard, sign of mourning or shame [[BDB#Che|Che]] [[BDB#Now|Now]] [[BDB#Benz|Benz]]<sup>Archaeology 165</sup> [[BDB#Now|Now]]<sup>Archaeology i. 195</sup>), so [[Ezek.24.17|Ezek 24:17]]; [[Ezek.24.22|Ezek 24:22]] (of leper) [[Lev.13.45|Lev 13:45]] ([[BDB#P|P]]); participle feminine <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עֹטְיָה‎</span> [[Song.1.7|Song 1:7]] as substantive, ***one wrapping*** ( a veil about her), i.e. a mourner; &gt; a harlot (compare [[Gen.38.14|Gen 38:14]]); but read perhaps <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎טֹעֲיָה‎</span> ***wandering woman***, see  <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎טעה‎</span>. — <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וַיַּעַט‎</span> etc., see  <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עיט‎</span>; <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מְעֻטָּה‎</span> etc., see also  <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עיט‎</span>. **Hiph\`il** ***Perfect*** 2 masculine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הֶעֲטִיתָ עָלָיו כּוּשָׁה‎</span> [[Ps.89.46|Ps 89:46]] (of <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎י‎</span>) ***thou hast wrapped shame upon him*** (enwrapped him in shame); ***Imperfect*** 3 masculine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בְּרָכוֺת יַעְטֶה מוֺרֶה‎</span> [[Ps.84.7|Ps 84:7]] ***early rain enwrappeth*** (it, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עֵמֶק הַבָּכָא‎</span> v<sup>a</sup>) ***with blessings*** ([[BDB#Sept|ᵐ5]] <span class="bdbLangGreek">δώσει</span>, as if from Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">, <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> III, IV. ***give***, compare [[BDB#Nes|Ne]]<sup>Marg.41</sup>); read probably also <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יַעֲטֵנִי‎</span> [[Isa.61.10|Isa 61:10]] (for [[BDB#MT|ᵑ0]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יְעָטָ֑נִי‎</span>, see  <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יעט‎</span>) ***with a robe of rightness he envelopeth me***,, so [[BDB#Brd|Brd]] [[BDB#Di|Di]] [[BDB#Ry|Ry]]<sup>Kau</sup> [[BDB#Du|Du]]; &gt; **Qal** ***Perfect*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עָטָ֑נִי‎</span> [[BDB#Klo|Klo]] [[BDB#Che|Che]]<sup>Hpt</sup>. 



 II. [<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עָטָה‎</span>] **verb** ==grasp== (Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">, <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> I, VII. ***take with hands***); — 

**Qal** ***Infinitive absolute*** + ***Participle active*** suffix <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וְעֹטְךָ עָטֹה‎</span> [[Isa.22.17|Isa 22:17]] ***he shall grasp thee forcibly***, compare [[BDB#Ges|Ges]]<sup>Comm.</sup> [[BDB#Hi|Hi]] [[BDB#Ew|Ew]] [[BDB#De|De]] [[BDB#Che|Che]]<sup>Comm.</sup> [[BDB#Di|Di]] [[BDB#Gu|Gu]]<sup>Kau</sup>; &gt; [[BDB#Thes|Thes]] [[BDB#Ges|Rob-Ges]] [[BDB#Buhl|Buhl]]<sup>Lex</sup> (13) from I. <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎טְה‎</span> (***he shall wrap, roll thee tight together***) for this verb not transitive
